content.description:
Start on the slab  just right of the Tryangle. Climb on low angle till you get into the corner (crux). Pull it and continue on more easy ground  to the top.
Named after Trevor Jones daughter, Kenzi


9 bolts

Highly featured, bomber slab all the way up! Start on the right side of the slab on a series of weaknesses, crossing to the left to gain the 3rd bolt. Head up using the lightning bolt features on your left, before crossing back to the right at bolt 7 to another set of features. Follow the remaining bolts to the rap rings which may be slightly obscured by a grass tuft. 

Stick to the slab and avoid touching the rock in the corner, it's loose!

Named by Tim Sutton for the "Summit Slayer" group.



From The Overhang sector, cross the creek and head up the canyon (~50 m), watching for the first slab section on your left. Of the two lines on this wall, this one is on the right and starts from under the "BaBach" bulge/overhang. 

10 bolts, rap rings

Easy, low angle climbing with a good chance of a wet rope after! The creek seasonally impedes access. Brief afternoon sun.

Both of these lines can be used to access the highline anchors above The North Face (with great caution).
